original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.🔽Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhagavato avidūre nisinno hoti pallaṅkaṁ ābhujitvā ujuṁ kāyaṁ paṇidhāya kāyagatāya satiyā ajjhattaṁ sūpaṭṭhitāya.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme  tena khalu pana samayena āyasmā mahāmoggallānaḥ bhagavataḥ avidūre nisinnaḥ hoti pallaṅkam ābhujitvā ujum kāyam paṇidhāya kāya gatāya satiyā ajjhattam su upaṭṭhitāya
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.🔽Now on that occasion the venerable Mahāmoggallāna was sitting not far from the Blessed One, his legs crossed, his body held erect, with mindfulness established to the fore.

original: Addasā kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ mahāmoggallānaṁ avidūre nisinnaṁ pallaṅkaṁ ābhujitvā ujuṁ kāyaṁ paṇidhāya kāyagatāya satiyā ajjhattaṁ sūpaṭṭhitāya.
analyzed: addasā khalu bhagavā āyasmantam mahāmoggallānam avidūre nisinnam pallaṅkam ābhujitvā ujum kāyam paṇidhāya kāya gatāya satiyā ajjhattam su upaṭṭhitāya
translated: The Blessed One saw the venerable Mahāmoggallāna sitting not far away, his legs crossed, his body held erect, with mindfulness established to the fore.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṁ viditvā tāyaṁ velāyaṁ imaṁ udānaṁ udānesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etam attham viditvā tāyam velāyam imam udānam udānesi
translated: Then, on realizing the significance of that, the Blessed One on that occasion exclaimed:
“Mindfulness directed to the body well established,
Controlled in the six fields of contact,
And he will know nibbāna for himself.”
